channel.title: Port on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Port on TLDRBins

item.title: Network Discovery
item.description: Test connectivity Linux Windows # Default infinite pings ping -c3 10.10.11.10 # Default 5 pings ping 10.10.11.10 # Check specific port Test-NetConnection <TARGET> -Port 5985 Test reverse connectivity Linux sudo tcpdump -ni tun0 icmp Sniff network traffic Linux # For example: on port 389 sudo tcpdump -i lo -nnXs 0 'port 389' # Sniff HTTPS traffic sudo ./mitmdump -p 443 --mode reverse:https://example.com --ssl-insecure --set flow_detail=3 Ref: mitmproxy Use ping to scan subnet Linux for i in $(seq 1 254); do (ping -c 1 10.

item.title: Nmap
item.description: Nmap Scan TCP UDP Script target=10.10.11.10 nmap -p- --min-rate 10000 -oA ./nmap-alltcp $target ports=$(cat nmap-alltcp.nmap| grep -Eo "^[0-9]+" | tr '\n' ',' | sed -r 's/,$//') nmap -p $ports -sCV -oA ./nmap-tcpscripts $target target=10.10.11.10 nmap -sU --min-rate 10000 -oA ./nmap-udp $target ports=$(cat nmap-udp.nmap| grep -Eo "^[0-9]+" | tr '\n' ',' | sed -r 's/,$//') nmap -p $ports -sU -sCV -oA ./nmap-udpscripts $target Update scripts DB nmap --script-updatedb Search scripts nmap --script-help ftp* Scan with a script nmap --script=ftp-anon -sV -sC -p 21 10.
